bill_title: revise certain provisions related to the care and maintenance of municipal cemeteries.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the type of machinery that may be purchased for maintaining municipal cemeteries. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-32-20.1 be amended to read as follows: 9-32-20.1. If a municipality finds it necessary to acquire heavy machinery to maintain the cemetery and to open and close graves, a portion of the perpetual care trust fund may be used under the following conditions: if the trust fund is in the amount of fifty thousand dollars or more , and the governing board deems it necessary to purchase heavy machinery for the proper interment of the deceased , . However, only one thousand dollars for each five thousand dollars in excess of fifty thousand may be expended to purchase heavy machinery for cemetery uses only. The expenditure of perpetual care trust funds as provided for in this section may only be used once in a seven-year period. Section 2. That § 9-32-20.2 be repealed. 9-32-20.2. For the purposes of § 9-32-20.1, heavy machinery includes diesel or gas backhoes, front-end loaders and other similar machinery with the purchase price of ten thousand dollars or greater. Heavy machinery does not include small riding lawn mowers, power rakes, sod cutters, lawn vacuums or other similar machinery. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to the care and maintenance of municipal cemeteries. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-32-20.1 be amended to read as follows: 9-32-20.1. If a municipality finds it necessary to acquire heavy machinery to maintain the cemetery and to open and close graves, Any municipality may expend a portion of the perpetual care trust fund may be used under the following conditions: if the trust fund is in the amount of fifty thousand dollars or more, and the governing board deems it necessary to purchase heavy machinery for the proper interment of the deceased, one thousand dollars for each five thousand dollars to maintain the cemetery. However, only amounts in excess of fifty thousand dollars may be expended to purchase heavy machinery and used for cemetery uses purposes only. The expenditure of perpetual care trust funds as provided for in this section may only be used once in a seven-year period. For expenditures in excess of five thousand dollars, notice of hearing shall be published twice, with the second notice not less than ten days in advance of the hearing. Section 2. That § 9-32-20.2 be repealed. 9-32-20.2. For the purposes of § 9-32-20.1, heavy machinery includes diesel or gas backhoes, front-end loaders and other similar machinery with the purchase price of ten thousand dollars or greater. Heavy machinery does not include small riding lawn mowers, power rakes, sod cutters, lawn vacuums or other similar machinery. BILL HISTORY 1/15/00 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 57 1/20/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/20/00 Local Government Do Pass, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 172 1/24/00 House of Representatives Do Pass, Passed, AYES 62, NAYS 4. H.J. 213 1/25/00 First read in Senate and referred to Local Government. S.J. 197 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 287 2/2/00 Local Government Place on Consent Calendar.
